U.S. businesses' fears range from outright piracy of their goods to the transfer of technological know-how that can be inevitable in joint ventures with Chinese companies. Sometimes Beijing mandates that foreign firms share technology, locate R&D in China and so forth, and the U.S. business community sees that as tying their hands when they go to China, said Kevin Gallagher , professor of international relations at Boston University.
